name: Dinner Tonight: Summer Panzanella
description: With a concept as simple as bread and tomatoes, a recipe seems almost worthless. But this one from Saveur stands out, if only for the garlic-infused bread. It's not an overwhelming stale garlic bread flavor—just a hint that perfumes this...
recipeIngredient: 1/4 of a baguette, cut into 1/2 inch cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven the 350°F. Melt the butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Pour in half of the olive oil, and let it warm for a minute. Turn off the heat, add the garlic and bread cubes. Toss until combined. Then place in the oven and cook for 15 minutes, tossing the cubes every 5 minutes or so.
Combine the chopped tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, and the other half of the oil. Stir until combined.
Add the bread to the bowl, sprinkle with the basil, and season with salt and pepper.
